title: Is Mercedes-AMG's Switch from V8 to Four-Cylinder Justified?
content:
The rumors were accurate—the iconic V8 has been swapped out for a four-cylinder powerhouse that drives all AMG compact cars. This new engine features electric turbocharging, boasting an impressive output of 350kW and 545Nm—quite a feat from a mere 2.0-liter four-pot.

Alas, our fears regarding the engine note have materialized. While modern engineering compensates for displacement through power multiplication, the distinct charm of the V8 remains irreplaceable. The sonorous decline traces back to the era of the 6.2 naturally aspirated mill a decade ago.

Embracing the hybrid wave brings forth even greater power and torque—500kW and 1020Nm, to be exact—compared to the previous 375kW and 700Nm. The weight of the C 63 has surged, demanding a strategic approach. To achieve these formidable numbers, a rear-mounted electric motor joins forces with the handcrafted four-pot upfront, augmenting the driving experience dynamically.

Significant Evolutions in Performance

Among the notable changes, the C 63 now integrates fully variable AWD akin to its competitors, bidding farewell to its distinctive rear-drive tradition. However, distinguishing itself from other models, this Mercedes permits the detachment of front-wheel drive for those seeking to drift, albeit under carefully controlled circumstances.

This iteration excels in peak power and torque, propelling faster in the linear dash with a substantial improvement in sprint performance. The acceleration clocks in at an impressive 3.4 seconds, marking a substantial enhancement in thrust.

The fusion of electric components with robust combustion engines has set a new standard in the realm of high-performance vehicles, with notable acceleration figures now more prevalent. Electric and hybrid hypercars elevate the accelerative benchmarks to new heights.

Innovations and Electrification

The fifth-generation W206 C 63 boasts additional upgrades, including rear-wheel steering for enhanced mechanical grip, agility, and stability in tight corners. The introduction of a plug for electric charging transforms the driving experience, offering a brief stint of electric-only propulsion, powered by a 6.3kWh battery pack.

Despite these advancements, the C 63 retains its intrinsic AMG DNA, striking a balance between dynamism and refinement. The integration of cutting-edge technology and electrification underscores the brand's commitment to innovation and performance.

As Mercedes reevaluates its hybrid strategy, the impending evolution in the CLE 63 hints at a potential return to a 4.0 twin-turbo V8 with mild hybrid technology—a move that could further distinguish it from competitors in the premium segment. The refined characteristics of the latest C 63 underscore a shift towards a harmonious blend of power and sophistication.

These transformative changes set the stage for an exciting era in AMG's performance lineup, offering enthusiasts a glimpse of what the future holds. The journey towards electrification and hybridization marks a pivotal moment in the brand's illustrious history, promising a fusion of innovation, performance, and driving pleasure for discerning consumers.

Model Mercedes-AMG C 63 S E Performance
Price $199,900
Engine 1991cc, IL4, T, DI
Power 350kW @ 6750rpm
Torque 545Nm @ 5000-5250rpm
Motor Output 150kW / 320Nm
Drivetrain 8-speed auto, AWD
Combined Output 500kW / 1020Nm
Fuel Use 6.1L/100km
C02 Output 223g/km
0-100km/h 3.14 sec
Tyre Size f-265/35/R20 r-275/35/R20
Fuel Capacity 60L
Stability systems ABS, ESP, TV
Safety AEB, ACC, BSM, LDW, RCTA, ALK, AHB
Luggage Capacity 279L
Tow rating Not rated to tow
Service intervals 12 months/25,000km
Warranty 3 years/unlimited km
ANCAP rating 5 Stars (2022)
Weight 2144kg (claimed)
section: For enthusiasts of the C 63, a pivotal change has arrived, signaling the end of an era while heralding a new one. In our last assessment of a 2019 C 63 wagon, we hinted at a looming shift: "Enjoy the V8 while you can, for the next iteration won't evoke the same thunderous allure."
